subject: Politics
title: Landlocked Nations
description: A quick, practical guide to Landlocked Nations.

hook.text: 44 countries have no coastline. Without sea access, they depend on neighbors just to reach the global market.

buildup.text: Landlocked countries can't ship goods by sea directly. They pay extra to cross borders and use others' ports.

discovery.text: Landlocked developing countries have GDP per capita 40% lower than coastal peers. Geography taxes their growth.

twist.text: Ethiopia lost its coast when Eritrea gained independence in 1993. Access to the sea became a diplomatic obsession.

climax.text: Some landlocked nations thrive anyway. Switzerland and Austria used trade and neutrality to overcome geography.

punchline.text: No coast means no cheap shipping. That one fact shapes a nation's future.

quiz.question: How does being landlocked affect a country's economy?
options: It raises shipping costs and limits direct access to global trade
It has no effect on economic development
